div.ab: ALHAMBRA GRANADA The House of the AlcaydeGovernor (alcaide) spoiled by repairs. in it the royal chapel was the royal mosque There is a miradorbalcony/oriel overlooking the carrera de Darrocourse of the Darro. Mahomet 3d called also Abu Abdalla built the mosque the chapel 21 & ½ varas 9 & ½ wide in the mosque a few plaisters or stucco of Solo Dios es vencedorOnly God is the victor remain, The columns are all arabic. The niche for the Coran remains A building alaparte oriental del Real Alcazar called Palacio del principeon the eastern part of the Royal Fortress called prince's Palace destined by Mahomed ben Juseph to Ismael his brother or because the prince of Asturias lodged in it when the Rroyal family came last to Granada. There is a hall 21 varas broad & 20 long. & in it inscrip Solo dios es vencedorOnly God is the victor. cupolas & hanging niches very rich in roof. In the next room an inscrip “Al mismo Dios.”To God himself / To the same God This hall 5 varas square 10 & ½ Varas high. 15 windows in it on Eeast Wwest & North. & “And the beauty thou hast emanates from God.” There is a miradorbalcony/oriel in this edifice which is very highly ornamented & supposed a Mirabmihrab, a niche indicating the direction of Mecca.. At the Eeast of this Palacio del principeprince's Palace a mosque 5 varas long 5 & ½ wide. 7 & ¼ high. “Solo dios”Only God in it now a Cinta (belt) makers houses “God is our help in all affliction.” – “Give Glory to God & consequently give thanks to God himself (or the same). On the Right of the calle RealRoyal street (at the Alhambra) says Padre EcheverriaEcheverría, Paseos por Granada is the Cadisthe house of the qadi, the judge of Islamic law house.

'170 years after Hegira': AH 170, by the Islamic calendar 'Ommiades': Umayyads 'Abbassides': Abbasids 'Berebers': Berbers
170 years after Hegira was Abd ar Rahman ben Moaire, ben Hashim Al Adaghel or the intruder, last of the Ommiades – He escaped from the Abbassides & with some Berebers seized Spain. Hashim 1 was his Son – Next Al Hakem 1 Abd ar Rahman 2, Mohammed 1, Al Mondher, Abd Ali, Abd ar Rahman 3. These reigned 279 years Ommiades. Hashim & his Hajib or Minister Al Mansour, rivals of Haroum ar Rashid & his Vizir Khaled ben Barmek.
il’ Allah لا إلهNo God Pertaining to 'Solo dios' in left-hand text [not from Westminster Review]. Part of ا إله إلا الله No God but Allah
Fatima – Lubna – Ayesha. Mariam learned Moorish Ladies Ayesha was beautiful like the rising moon – fine & slender like a young aloe bending its head to the southern breeze. if she ran she looked like an antelope disappointing the sportsman by her rapid flight, & if occupied by study or meditation her eyes resembled the soft & melting eyes of the Gazelle looking from the top of a rock on the burning sands of the desert. Ibn Hayan.
